intro: Listera reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf springbeauty, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually kidney-shaped, and it produces small, clustered flowers in the spring. Listera reniformis is often found in rich, loamy soils and is an important component of early spring flora.
